SENT.plain: GADD34 is expressed in the ischaemic brain and reverses protein synthesis shutdown
Consequently, GADD34 could have neuroprotective potential in stroke

BHK medium, a replication-deficient HSV viral vector (HSV1716) with no insert or containing full-length GADD34, the N terminal or a conserved portion of the gene, was injected into mouse brain before stroke
The increase in infarct size with full-length GADD34 was statistically significant (P<0.05)
Tissue culture studies revealed GADD34 gene restored virulence in HSV1716, suggesting that HSV virulence, rather than increased GADD34, exacerbated ischaemic damage
